attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my displeasure with the changes in fees for the processing
of the I600-A to get a 171-H, as well as the cost for fingerprinting and increase in
the costs of a certificate of citizenship. These increases are over 100% in many
cases. None of us can ask for a 100% raise, and asking for this increase puts
undue hardship on parents wishing to adopt and give loving homes to children. It
appears the goverment wishes to make more money off of these children's
misfortune. As adoptive parents often have to subumit a second I600-A and get
refingerprinted due to increased international waits for adoption, this constitutes
a "double whammie" anyway, without the additional rate increases. Please
reconsider these outrageous rate increases. Cost of living and inflation costs are
understandible, but adding hundreds of dollars to each fee is excessive.

Sincerely,
Jennifer Smith
adoptive mother
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jennifer Smith
